Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not much what's up with you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I can not believe I fell for that. [laughing] Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, ah, ah, what? What? Where's the funny? Give it to me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Umm, is it me or does it smell like up-dog in here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's up-dog?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothin' much what's up with you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, wow! I walked right into that. Oh, that's brilliant!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Stanley, is that jacket make of up-dog?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm on the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm, what flavour coffee is that? Up-dog?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, nothin', what's up with you?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [low] No, damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What does what mean?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The thing you just said?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just forget it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight! Hey is it me or does this place smell like up-dog?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's up-dog?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gotcha! [laughing] Oh, God. [low] Crap! Nothin' how ya doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. How are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [mouthing] So close.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [low] Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today is spring cleaning day here at Dunder Mifflin. And yes I know its January. I am not an idiot. But, if you do your Spring cleaning in January; guess what you don't have to do in the spring? Anything. They say a cluttered desk means a cluttered mind. Well I say that an empty desk means a...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Empty mind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that's not... no, that's not what I was going to say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Meredith, men's room. Make sure you replace the urinal cakes. They're worn down. Kevin file drawers. Angela kitchen. Oscar dusting. Where is Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He's out sick.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's unacceptable.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I agree it's unacceptable. [longing look]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whhh... What are you guys doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oscar is out sick.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On a Friday? [Dwight nods]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I do some of the talking?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will do all the talking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, let him know that I'm here.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What difference does it make whether your here?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, Oscar its Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yechh, yeah, um, heard you were under the weather?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah I think I came down with the flu.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Oh, that is a shame. You know it's cleaning day here today? Could have used some of that famous Hispanic cleaning ethic.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, I feel terrible about it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ask him his symptoms. I'm on Web M.D.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are your symptoms?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I have the chills.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Umm, hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I feel nauseous and my heads killing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Checks out.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael is there anything you need from me? I'd like to go back to bed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need you to go back to bed. I need you to get better. See you Monday. Unless you're still sick. So have a great long weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll just be sleep-- [Michael hangs up the phone before Oscar can finish]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. First impressions?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He sounded sick.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which is exactly how you'd wanna sound like if you wanted someone to think you were sick.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's exactly what I was thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question? May I investigate?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Drop what you're doing. Make this a priority. Because an office can't function efficiently unless people are at their desks doing their jobs.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I bought my veil.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God! That is so exciting! Can I be a bridesmaid?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ummm...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Listen, you don't have to answer now. But how are you going to do your hair?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok. I was thinking about wearing it down. Kind of like, I don't know, like loose with big curls and...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You'd look like an angel. I'm seriously going to cry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wowweee. Mikey likey. Why don't you wear your hair like that all the time. It's much sexier. [Pam puts hair back up] [Michael walks by Jim] Man, this must be torture for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. On the booze cruise I told Michael about some feelings I used to have for Pam. I had just broken up with Katy and had a couple drinks. And I confided in the world's worst confidant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Jim-bag.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Remember that thing I told you on the booze cruise about Pam? That... was... personal so if we can just keep that between you and me. That would be great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Umm, hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who else knows?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nobody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim and I are great friends. We hang out a ton, mostly at work. But, the fact that he told me his secret and no one else knows says everything about our friendship. And it is why, I intend on keeping that secret for as long as I possibly can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My lips are sealed. [singing] My lips are sealed... Bangles.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. Great. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Can you hear me, they talk about us...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen Temp. I am conducting a little investigation so I'm no longer going to be able to head up spring cleaning. Do you think you can handle it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think I can handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you think? Or do you know?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I think.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [low] Oh God, here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, whatcha gettin'?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm going with grape.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, good stuff, good stuff. Did you see the game last night?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which one?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Any of em? So, uh, what's the 411? Any news on the "P" situation?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know what you mean.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: P-A-M. P-A

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, uh, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it's okay, we're talking code.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen Stanley. How long does it take you to pick out a soda?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm going to take off actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, well, cool. [Michael walks by Jim] Still deciding?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael presses a button for Stanley] Peach iced tea. You're going to hate it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey Oscar how ya doin'? Dwight Schrute calling. Listen a little question for you, buddy. I called six minutes ago and no one answered. So I was wondering if you could explain. Oh, I see, so. Sounds like you're too sick to come into work but your well enough to go to the pharmacy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There are several different ways to tell if a perp is lying. The liar will avoid direct eye contact. The liar will cover part of his or her face with his hands, especially the mouth. The liar will perspire. Unfortunately I spoke to Oscar on the phone so none of this is useful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's Grrrrrrape! Soda.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tony the tiger. You don't hear that much any more.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not so much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, what is going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, really nothing? Fact: You are drinking grape soda. You never drink grape soda. Fact: You are talking to Jim. You never talk to Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fact: I love grape soda. I always have. Fact: Jim and I talk all the time. We tell each other secrets.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. So what is the secret Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, I had asked Michael if I could head up the Oscar investigation and he said that only Dwight was capable of handling such sensitive material.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that true?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, I don't know, yeah, yeah, yeah it is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you Michael. I know your telling the truth.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can tell. I won't let you down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whooo, nice. That was, that was slick. What are you doin' for lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know probably just gonna eat my ham and cheese sandwich in the break room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh nonsense [lifts leg and puts it on Jim's desk], no way, no. Why don't, why don't I take you out to lunch? My treat.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, that's alright, thank you though. It's, I, gotta do some cleaning, should probably stick around here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey you know what we could do? We could spread out a blanket in the break room. Have a little picnic order some 'za. Talk about you know who.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, ah, no but no. You know what let's go out. That was a good idea. Let's go out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know just he place.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [at Hooters] Oh man, you should order milk. Get it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do I like Hooters? Well I will give you two reasons, the boobs and the hot wings.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, here we go, here we go. Bogy at 3 o'clock. Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: Hey I'm Dana. Welcome to Hooters.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're not worthy. We're not worthy. Hello Dana, I am Michael and this is Jim and we are brothers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope we're not brothers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm his boss actually. And I treat him well. I'm taking him out to lunch cause I can afford it and he can have whatever he wants.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I just have the ham and cheese sandwich, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: And for you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell me Dana, how is your chicken breast?

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: Oh, it's great. It's served with our world famous wing sauce.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmmm, sounds yummy. I will have a chicken breast hold the chicken. [Giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: Is that what you really want?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm gonna have the gourmet hot dog.

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who took all the black ones?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's a communal bowl.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, how did Oscar sound when he called in?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sick, like lots of sniffling. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sniffling how?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Umm. How many different ways are there to sniffle?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Three.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, it was the second one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, good, thank you. That wasn't so hard now was it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nuh-uh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you like best about Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, I really don't want to talk about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is it her boobs, or...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, she's easy to talk to I guess and she's got a really good sense of humor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Never get's any of my jokes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What about you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Her boobs, definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that's not what I meant.

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: And I understand we have a birthday today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohhh happy birthday Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: Ready girls? Front side.

Quote.Speaker: Hooter's Girls
Quote.Text: You put your front side in; you put your front side out. You put your front side in and shake it all about. You do the hokey pokey and you turn yourself around. That's what it's all about. Whoo, hoo!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woo! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks, thanks Dana.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hilarious. Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What did you guys talk about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Holds up Hooters t-shirt] Just you know politics, literature.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I hate you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Quick Oscar update. I have conducted interviews with everyone in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just go to his house and see if he's sick. I could have done this Investigation in like twenty minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Including prep time?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just do it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: If I had to I could clean out my desk in five seconds and nobody would ever know I had ever been here. And I'd forget too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael messes up hair to look like Jim's] Expenses.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael is that a wig?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. It's... I wear it like that sometimes. Is that a wig?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is from Hooters.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's a business lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Did Toby approve this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No he did not. I don't need his permission.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You just got your corporate credit card back. Do you really want me to take it away again?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uhhh it's ridiculous. They took my card away because I spent $80 bucks at a magic shop. What they don't understand is that I bought the stuff to impress potential clients. So business related, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I put a cigarette through a freakin' quarter. And you know what Toby? They almost bought from us.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm not processing this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look Jim needed a relaxing lunch, he has been depressed and it has been affecting his productivity. How is that not work related?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: He seems fine to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're not his friend, you don't know. He is in love with a girl he works with who's engaged. So just cut me some slack. Please?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Phylis
Quote.Text: Angela who would you choose Jim or Roy?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's nobody's business, Phyllis. Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jim has got it bad for Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh ho! Which one is Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well she's the... Hey Michael so do you think Jim will try to break up the wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what Kevin? Jim is a friend of mine, so the only people that this crush really concerns is Jim and Pam... and me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: As a volunteer Sheriff's Deputy I have been doing surveillance for years. One time I suspected an ex-girlfriend of mine of cheating on me. So I tailed her for six straight nights. Turns out she was, with a couple of guys actually so... mystery solved.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Jim, why didn't you tell me you had a crush on Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well the cats out of the bag. I used to have a crush on Pam and now I [hesitate] don't. Riveting.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice... she is so hot.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you find anything good in your desk?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, coupon for a free sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Score.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It expired in August, and my cell phone charger from two years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Big day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Big day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey oh, listen, um, I told Michael on the booze cruise. It's so stupid. Um, I told Michael that I had had a crush on you when you first started here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well I thought that, I figured you should hear it from me rather than, I mean you know Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And seriously, it's totally not a big deal, ok? And when I found out you were engaged, I mean.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I know, like, I kind of like, I thought that maybe you did when I first started.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh you did?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I mean, just 'cause we like got along so well.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, you saw through me, great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So are you going to be like totally awkward around me now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, yeah... hope that's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm, hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And Pam it was like three years ago so I am totally over it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stay low... This is it... There he is. He's been gone for at least two hours. Who is that? Come to Papa... Oh yes. Let's roll. I knew it! You are so busted. Ice skates, shopping bags? I think I know what's going on here. You weren't sick at all.

Quote.Speaker: Gil
Quote.Text: Who's this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is Dwight Schrute. Who is this?

Quote.Speaker: Gil
Quote.Text: Gil.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Are you going to tell Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How bout this. I don't tell Michael and in exchange you owe me one great big giant favor. Redeemable by me at a time and place of my choosing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Guess what I found out about Oscar tonight? He was lying about being sick. Should I have reported Oscar's malfeasance. Hmm, probably, but now I know something he doesn't want me to know. So I can use his malfeasance to establish leverage. Otherwise, it's just malfeasance for malfeasanceses-ses sake.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Umm, what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, oh, just, um, I know I was trying to, expense reports. And then God, Toby, you know he just... I know. I'm just, I just hope that, I just hope that [starts to get choked up] this doesn't affect our friendship! Stupid, this is so stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, wow, wow. Listen man it's, you know what. It's not a big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, I'm fine, no I know, I'm good, I'm good, it's just.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look its one day, everything's gonna be alright. No big deal. You good?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Creed did you organize the menu book?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh, I thought that was more on a volunteer basis.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, that was mandatory.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh, I thought it was a volunteer thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, here's your schedule for next week. Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah I'm fine. Look, about you and Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no, that's, you don't have to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I feel it's my responsibility as your boss slash friend.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, really, it's okay. I know that Jim had, like a crush on me when he first started. But that was a long time ago, so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It wasn't that long ago. It was on the booze cruise.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim had a crush on me on the booze cruise or he told you about it on the booze cruise?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yehhh, okay, shuuttt it Michael. I'm done. That's it. I'm out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: People are always coming to me. "Michael, I have a secret. Your the only one I trust." No thanks, because keeping a secret can only lead to trouble. Like I was watching Cinemax last weekend. This movie, Portrait of a... Prostitute something. Secrets of a Call... More Secrets of a Call Girl. And the lead character, Shila, is framed for murder. She goes on the run and winds up working at a bordello in Malibu. I don't, I don't want to live like that. I like it here. I don't want to be Shila, I like being Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. Pammy want a cracker?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No thanks. You got a package.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Pam with the dirty talk. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And he's lining it up. Seems pretty straightforward from here. If Michael Scott sinks it, he'll win a Buick signed by Tiger Woods.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He totally misses,

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, he meant to put it right next to the hole, that's much harder to do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Interception. He shoots, he scores, yeah! Michael, try it like this. This'll be much harder.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. I don't want to chip my mug. Please get that off the floor. [sets mug on the edge of Michael's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Jack Nicholson for birdie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jack Nicholas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a celebrity tournament.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [golf ball rolls under bookcase] I got it. No problem. [clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you see it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, man, it's really back there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you feel it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. I can barely...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mug falls off Michel's desk and smashes on the floor] God... damn it, Dwight! That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Should I clean out my desk?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pulls a brand new mug out of his desk door] That won't be necessary.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't be fooled by the phrase "dust bunnies." They are vicious little bitches and if they get inside your disc drive, God help you. They will bring your computer to its knees. They sit in corners hatching, defecating, laying eggs. And their sole purpose in life is to eat dead skin, which humans in this office shed by the boat load. Especially Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at all them out there, my little worker bees buzzing away.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If they're the worker bees, you're the Queen bee.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I am the King bee,

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Queen's higher.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, King is higher. Then Ace. I am the Ace bee.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: People Magazine, crossword puzzle, keep or toss?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Keep. I will finish that later.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's from '99.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know when it's from, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: 18 across. Mary-Kate and Ashley blank." Michael wrote, "Judd?"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I rushed a few fraternities, but you know what? I don't believe in paying for friendships. So, I made a decision not to accept any offers. And fortunately none were made. Which was good, so nobody's feelings got hurt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Temp, shouldn't you be monitoring the progress of people's cleaning efforts?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Everything seems pretty much under control.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. Well, I'd hate to see it blow up in your face.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How would...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's table that. So, temp... You seem to be pretty close to this Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Not really.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Getting defensive?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You seem a little nervous. You shouldn't be.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Dana.

Quote.Speaker: Dana
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Keep the change. Here you go buddy, happy birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you what, seriously, you should have it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. I have the long sleeve. And actually, you know what we should do? We should wear them tomorrow to work, it'll be hysterical.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, tomorrow, that's gonna be tough 'cause I already laid out my outfit, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Tuesday. Whenever. You'd better try it on, make sure it fits.
